issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
TestDataNodeVolumeFailureReporting#testSuccessiveVolumeFailures fails frequently in Jenkins runs but it passes locally on my dev machine.

e.g. https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/21134/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode/TestDataNodeVolumeFailureReporting/testSuccessiveVolumeFailures/

{code}
Error Message

test timed out after 120000 milliseconds

Stacktrace

java.lang.Exception: test timed out after 120000 milliseconds
	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DFSTestUtil.waitReplication(DFSTestUtil.java:761)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.TestDataNodeVolumeFailureReporting.testSuccessiveVolumeFailures(TestDataNodeVolumeFailureReporting.java:189)

{code}
fields.summary: TestDataNodeVolumeFailureReporting fails in trunk Jenkins runs

comments.body: We plan to start merge vote of 3.1.0 on Feb 18, please let me know if any plan to finish this by Feb 18 or we need to move itÂ to 3.2.0.

Thanks for the patch Xiaoyu! I just found when going through the patch that you have a typo when defining INTERNAL_DFS_BLOCK_SCANNER_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_INTERVAL = "internal.dfs.block.scanner.shutdown.wait.intervaL"
I think the string should be internal.dfs.block.scanner.shutdown.wait.interval with lowercase l.
good catch. Upload v2 patch that fixed the typo.

[~xyao], if this patch can be done by this week, please commit to branch-3.1 as well. Thanks.

I looked over the patch ( [^HDFS-12452.002.patch])  and it looks like it reduces the duration for which the BlockScanner waits on the VolumeScanner thread to shutdown in {{removeVolumeScanner}}. This would be triggered when the creation of the Rbw fails and {{checkDiskErrorAsync}} is called in {{FileIoProvider#onFailure}}. This being an asynchronous call shouldn't be in the critical path of the test finishing right?

Thanks [~virajith] for looking at the issue. The stack traces without the fix revealed the block scanner shutdown caused the test timeout. Â The problem is that the test itself timeout in 3 minutes but the block scanner shutdown wait can take up to 5 minutes (hard-coded). We could either extend the test timeout but I think it will be more efficient to use Jenkins resource if we allow testÂ to setup a shorter block scanner shutdown wait.

Hi [~xyao]

As this jira is marked for 3.2 as a Critical, cud u pls help to take this forward or move out if its not feasible to finish in coming weeks. 3.2 code freeze date isÂ nearby inÂ aÂ weeks. Kindly help to check the same.
